one.title: Record your notes
one.content: By dictating, you generate more complete notes and your patients feel part of the consultation.

two.title: Organize
two.content: Swipe each note to the right and classify it according to its moment of the visit. Slide cases and notes sideways for more features.

three.title: Share your notes
three.content: Use the email sharing feature to send pseudonymized notes to colleagues or patients. With the desktop version you can copy and paste notes in seconds.

export.sent_to: A copy of your notes has been sent to the email:

demo_mode.title: You are now in Beeseet's Demo Mode
demo_mode.content: To unlock all the features of Beeseet, just create your account

create_case.i_have_consent: By checking this box, I certify that I have the patient's consent to record his clinical notes on Beeseet.

case.no_notes_desc: Start by dictating your first note!
case.no_notes_placeholder: Enter text of this note here...

pics.delete_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this image?

one.content: When you use the desktop version of Beeseet, the notes you record from your phone will appear in real time on your computer. If you prefer, you can prepare your cases from the computer.
one.title: Your notes in real time

three.content: Use the copy function to send your notes to the clipboard in seconds, then you can paste them into the application you need them without hassle. If you need to copy a single note, just click on it.
three.title: Copy and paste

two.content: Don't have time to correct or classify the notes on your phone during the visit? No problem, you can do it easily on the desktop version, just as you do on your phone.
two.title: Classify and correct

desktopinfo.body: With Beeseet Desktop you can have access, from your computer and in real time, to all your Beeseet notes. Edit them comfortably and copy them to the electronic system at your workplace.
desktopinfo.cta_title: Ready to try it? Visit this link from your computer:
desktopinfo.header: Your notes, where you need them
desktopinfo.title: Beeseet Desktop

purchase.title: Dictate your clinical notes, Beeseet transcribes and organizes them

your_subscription.title: Subscription
your_subscription.android_instructions: To modify or cancel your subscription, go to the Play Store on your mobile. Open the menu and locate Subscriptions. Remember that even if you cancel, you will have access during the period that you have already paid for.
your_subscription.ios_instructions: To modify or cancel your subscription, on your iOS device, go to Settings, click on your name and then go to Subscriptions. If you don't see the Cancel option, your subscription is already canceled and will not be renewed. Remember that even if you cancel, you will have access during the period that you have already paid for.

logout.title: Logout
logout.content: Are you sure you want to close your session?

delete_case.title: Delete case?
delete_case.content: Are you sure you want to delete this case?

delete_note.title: Delete note?
delete_note.content: Are you sure you want to delete this note?

verif.title: Verify your identity
verif.content: To let you get into our hive, we will need your professional ID. This will allow you to access all Beeseet's social features.

success.title: Your identity has been verified!
success.content: You have now full access to Beeseet’s cloud and your social profile is verified.

pending.title: Your identity is in validation process (it usually takes about 24 hours)

fail.title: We couldn’t verify your identity
fail.content: We had problems verifying your identity. Our team will contact you as soon as possible to solve this problem.

casos: You don't have any cases yet
empieza: Start and create your first note !

errors.cannot_load: Can't load items at this time

errors.emty_mail: Please fill in your email first
errors.policy_check: You must accept our Terms and Conditions and Privacy Policy to register

first_case.body: To protect the privacy of the patient, don't use their personal data as case identifier. Use the assigned case number to facilitate search later.
first_case.title: Patient privacy

first_rec_done.title: Correct and enrichen
first_rec_done.body: Here you can edit the text and correct any errors. You can also add photos to this note before saving it. You can always edit it again later

dictation.tip10: When you dictate a TEST READING, organize all the reports that you want to reflect in the history and be prepared to dictate what you really think is relevant about each one.
dictation.tip1: Dictating is an act of communication, both the app and the patient need to understand you clearly.
dictation.tip11: When you photograph the patient or any of their tests, make sure to hide their face and any data related to their identity.
dictation.tip2: Use a moderate speed when dictating to ensure correct transcription.
dictation.tip3: Translation experts indicate that dictating as if you were explaining to an 8-year-old schoolboy is a good way to know if you are doing it right.
dictation.tip4: Synthesizing is key. Avoid long monologues. Be specific about the key points you want to collect.
dictation.tip5: You can use punctuation marks in your dictation. Say TWO POINTS, POINT AND AWAY, etc. At first it will feel weird, but in a few days you won't even notice it.
dictation.tip6: Use dictation as a way to be transparent. By involving the patient, he or she can correct you in case you make a mistake in any detail.
dictation.tip7: When dictating a BACKGROUND, remember to mention: illnesses and medications (use their prescriptions or past history)
dictation.tip8: When giving an ANAMNESIS, remember to mention: Main complaint? When? How? What have you tried to fix it? If it's too long or has multiple complaints, use multiple notes for it.
dictation.tip9: When you give a PHYSICAL EXAM, follow a scheme of how you report the physical findings: Inspection, Palpation, Maneuvers, etc.

first_copy_web.title: Copy & Paste
first_copy_web.body: Click on a note to edit it or double-click to copy it to the clipboard. You can copy all the notes with the button at the bottom. Swipe them to the right to assign them a category.
